section.title: Rationale
section.lq: I was wondering if anyone knows of an extension that's been developed that allows you to add a <note> element *between* <step> elements in a DITA task. (Even if you have to wrap it in an <info> element.) There are places in our documentation where we need a cautionary statement to come before a step or a series of steps. Putting it within the previous step's element won't cut it.
section.codeblock: <steps> <step><cmd>This is the first step.</cmd></step> <info><note type="warning">Here is a warning statement that needs to come before the next step.</note></info> <step><cmd>This is the next step.</cmd></step> <step><cmd>You get the point.</cmd></step> </steps>

p.cite: Mike Kokic, correspondence to dita-users Yahoo group
